channel.title: math.HO updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.HO updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Patterns in Growth and Distribution of Unbounded Prime Number Walks
item.description: arXiv:2506.15357v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In our previous work, we defined a prime walk (PW) on a square grid and presented several intriguing numerical results. Here, we demonstrate the main conjecture presented there, namely, that the area covered by the prime walk is unbounded. Taking this fact into account, we examine in further detail the properties of the PW and explore new questions that arise naturally in this analysis.
item.dc:creator: Alberto Fraile, Daniel Fern\'andez, Roberto Mart\'inez, Theophanes E. Raptis

item.title: Measure and integration
item.description: arXiv:2506.15534v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: This is an introduction to measure theory, integration and function spaces, with all the needed preliminaries included, and with some applications included as well. We first discuss some basic motivations, coming from discrete probability, that we develop in detail, as a preliminary to general measure theory. Then we discuss measure theory, integration and function spaces, all developed in a standard way, and with emphasis on the explicit computation of various integrals. Finally, we come back to probability, discrete and continuous, with a more advanced discussion, of quantum flavor.
item.dc:creator: Teo Banica
